intro: Andrachne orbicularis, commonly known as the roundleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, orbicular (rounded) leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a low, mat-like growth habit and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Andrachne orbicularis is a perennial plant that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
